articles.headline: Despite Russian Warnings, Finland and Sweden Draw Closer to NATO
articles.snippet: The invasion of Ukraine has heightened security fears, pushing even formally nonaligned countries toward the Western alliance.
articles.abstract: The invasion of Ukraine has heightened security fears, pushing even formally nonaligned countries toward the Western alliance.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Even before his invasion of Ukraine, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia had warned Sweden and Finland of “retaliation” should they join NATO. It was, after all, Ukraine’s desire to join the alliance that he cited time and again as provocation for his war.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Johanna Lemola

articles.headline: ‘Clear Patterns’ of Russian Rights Abuses Found in Ukraine, Report Says
articles.snippet: Momentum is building to try to bring war crimes charges tied to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
articles.abstract: Momentum is building to try to bring war crimes charges tied to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
articles.lead_paragraph: Investigators from almost a dozen countries combed bombed-out towns and freshly dug graves in Ukraine on Wednesday for evidence of war crimes, and a wide-ranging investigation by an international security organization detailed what it said were “clear patterns” of human rights violations by Russian forces.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora, Erika Solomon and Carlotta Gall

articles.headline: A New Legal Tactic to Protect Workers’ Pay
articles.snippet: The Justice Department is using antitrust law to charge employers with colluding to hold down wages. The move adds to a barrage of civil challenges.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department is using antitrust law to charge employers with colluding to hold down wages. The move adds to a barrage of civil challenges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Antitrust suits have long been part of the federal government’s arsenal to keep corporations from colluding or combining in ways that raise prices and hurt the consumer. Now the government is deploying the same weapon in another cause: protecting workers’ pay.

articles.headline: Gopuff Does Deliveries in 30 Minutes or Less. It’s Also Buying Time for Itself.
articles.snippet: The $15 billion rapid-delivery start-up decided to do business differently from rivals like Instacart. A changing environment is testing its model.
articles.abstract: The $15 billion rapid-delivery start-up decided to do business differently from rivals like Instacart. A changing environment is testing its model.
articles.lead_paragraph: From its beginning in 2013, Gopuff aimed to do rapid delivery differently.

articles.headline: Hiding in Plain Sight, a Soviet-Era Air Defense System Arrives in Ukraine
articles.snippet: Encouraged by the United States, Slovakia “donated” a bulky but effective S-300, hoping to challenge Russian domination of the skies in the war next door.
articles.abstract: Encouraged by the United States, Slovakia “donated” a bulky but effective S-300, hoping to challenge Russian domination of the skies in the war next door.
articles.lead_paragraph: DOBRA, Slovakia — Driving back to his village near the Ukrainian border last Thursday, the mayor had to stop to let a train pass, and assumed he wouldn’t have to wait long. But the flatbed wagons, stacked high with military equipment, just kept coming. He waited for nearly half an hour.
